intro: Micranthes unalaschcensis, commonly known as the Alaska mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Alaska and western Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cold, harsh environments. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually white or pale pink, blooming in early summer. Micranthes unalaschcensis is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability in its habitat.
